intro: Oreocharis nemoralis var. lanata, commonly known as the woolly oreocharis, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, woolly leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Its unique foliage and ornamental flowers make it a sought-after species in horticulture.
